ify for label registration for a
new insecticide or household
chemical.


Earl Brenn, president of the
Chemical Specialties Manufac-
turers Association, warns that
using any chemical without fol-
lowing directions, "is akin to
reaching into the medicine cabi-
net in the dark and taking the
first pill that comes to hand"


The manufacturers label not
only outlines the safety precau-
tions to be taken, it also tells
exactly which insects will be
destroyed by which insecticide.


For example, the Department
of Agriculture permits certain
chemicals to be labeled for home
use against reaches and silver
fish but not against flies or mos
quitoes. Other chemicals are la
beled for use in combating carpet
beetles and spiders but not fleas
or brown dog ticks.


Yet, in spite of the trouble
taken by manufacturers and the
U. S. Government, accidental
poisonings, especially among
children, are all too common.
Why? Carelessness!


It's so easy to save lives. Just
READ THAT LABEL!

An item in the daily paper
caused me to stop and null over
a few facts of life. Now readers.
do not stop reading though it
does concern Mother Nature.


Some new animals have been
added to one of the large met
ropolitan ZOOS. Pigs and COWS
have been brought to a small
farmlike area, which is COM
pleted with mixers and a man
operating tractor.


Today as we see the results
of the rocket age--the spade
age-the atomic age or call it
what you will was jolted back
to reality when | began musing.


There are thousands of child
rem who have never seen a real
COW, heard a hen cluck, nor a
rooster crow. Doubtlessly some
do not realize that milk comes
from cows and not cans. Some
might be deluded by oversimpli-
fication of natural phenomena that
milk in it's pure form is now pow
der, nor do eggs come neatly
stacked in cartons.


Modern housewives have
caused new and simpler methods
of food preparation and service
to be devised. They have insis-
ted on instant potatoes, powdered
eggs, sugar substitute and ~
dinners.


Since the turn of the twentieth
century-more and more, persons
have moved from the farms to
the city--but we still depend on
the farms for our foodstuffs.


There are more larger farms
now but their ia SKIS are greater.
There are more individuals to
feed and more ways of shipping
products across the nation.


Ia stes in foods are no longer
localized. Some per sons who
grew up in the pre-piggyback
shipping days never knew of the
fruitless and even gritless meals.


AS committee of one | will
begin a campaign to bring the
farm back TO America. My group
will be called the BBAF bring
Back American Farms). At least
one small scale farm should be
placed in each large city, per-
haps, it could serve S the CEN
ter of urban renewal plans. Then
we could all go down on the farm
when we shopped upt own or down
town.


The next time you break an egg
or quaff glass of milk--pause
and give thanks that all of this
was produced and brought to you
through the efforts of our free
farmers-who though subsidized
are not collectivized.


READ WELL BEFORE USINGl

The most expensive words
you'll ever read are those on
household chemical and insecti-
eide labels. They're some of the
most important words, too.

Re cent remarks made by j. Edgar Hoover,
20 years old, dire ctov of the Federal Bureau
of Mves tigation, stating that Dr.. Martin
Luther King, JY., noted ciVil rights leader,
uas q liar created shock throughout the nation.


Dr.. King has been one Of the most popular
Negro figures IN the current de c0de. HIS
popularity no doubt exceeds that accredited
to the heavyweight champion Joe Louis, at
the height of his fistic career.


As the re cent uOinneY Of the Nobel Prize
for his contributions to peace and leader
ship, Dr.. King, has received ntevuatiotaal
acclaim, plus the blauditS at home.


His courage during the southern crises
and his foYsOaYd abbyo0 oh has stirred men
in all walks Of life to heed the cries Of the
race which has suffered ineqaaa titles for
hundreds of years.


Dr. King charged that FBI officers often
ignored Negroes in southern racial incidents
and that they weye not putting forth all
efforts to SOlUe kidnabbings and nauvde rings
OF the coloyed people.


ms charges brought bitter yetoyts from
q. Edgar Hoover, sOb0 has headed the hzgh-
est Ian enforcement agency in the nation
under four presidents. Perhaps, this long
term Of service is showing its strain on the
FBI dire ct0Y, who according to trends in
business and industry, is past retirement
age.


The head Of the FBI has high standards to
uphold and he should never make rash and
senSelesS statements. For many years
Hoover has been Yega yded with vesbect and
and these years of service should not end
on such sour notes.


Dr.. King has been involved in many

not he0TS0y. There are others who doubt
the total action Of the FBI esbe cially since
the disappearance or death of more than
dozen Negroes in the deep South during
the last Is months.
